case_title: IFTIKHAR AHMAD, ADVOCATE vs ABDUL RAZIQ, ADVOCATE
legal_issues: Violation of Legal Practitioners and Bar Councils Act, 1973

respondent_role: Counsel for prosecution in bail cancellation application

complainant.main_claim: Respondent violated professional conduct by acting as both witness and counsel.
legal_basis: Legal Practitioners and Bar Councils Act, 1973
Rule 157 of Legal Practitioners and Bar Councils Rules, 1976
case_references: Mst. Razia Begum v. Sardar Muhammad Ishaq, Advocate (1990 MLD 1441)

respondent.main_defense: No violation of rules or professional misconduct occurred.
respondent.legal_basis: Rule 157 of Legal Practitioners and Bar Councils Rules, 1976

government.argument: Respondent violated Rule 157 by acting in dual capacities.

key_points: No evidence of respondent acting as counsel after appearing as Court-witness.
